title: 10 Best Free Steam Games That Should Cost Lots of Money

json.text: You don't have to pay loads of money to play a good video game, because sometimes quality comes free of charge, and Steam is usually
the best place to find such hidden treasures. There are quite a lot of
free-to-play games on this platform and some of them are really complex titles with gameplay that can be enjoyed for hours or even days.
And this is why we thought it would be only fair to share with you our pick of 10 of the best Steam games that
should break the bank, but are actually totally free.
Paladins is an early access title that successfully mixes a team-based shooter gameplay with strategy elements and deep character customization.
The unique
collectible card system allows players to upgrade their character's core set of abilities in order to create the best build that really suits their gameplay style.
In Paladins everything is free to play, any element that affects the player's performance being unlocked via in-game achievements.
This multiplayer first-person shooter has some pretty stunning visuals, as well as very exciting gameplay.
Hawken lets you take control of a mechanized war machine and
tasks you with survival among the harsh battle fields of a dystopian world called Illal. You'll be able to enjoy the various game modes
lets you explore stunning alien landscapes while tinkering with the customizable and upgradable mechs available.
Planetside 2 is an MMOFPS that is set among an all-out planetary war where the player can take part in intense missions.
Infantry, air and ground vehicles can be used to take control of critical territories and key resources for the empire
you're serving. The soldier, weapons and vehicles
you can choose can be extensively customized as to match even the most pretentious of tastes.
Planetside 2, offering a highly complex and detailed gameplay.
A cross-Platform MMO combat game, War Thunder features a wide array of vehicles used during the World War II and the Korean war
periods. The immersive and authentic combat takes place in the air, on land
and on the sea,
and it manages to bring together an impressive number of players in an ever-changing environment.
A Guinness world record-breaking number of aircrafts is also included in this highly realistic game.
Blacklight: Retribution is a very popular FPS video game, receiving special praise for its deep customization
options, as well as the intense firefights you partake in while playing. It is often compared to Call of Duty,
and some say it should even surpass in its fame and fanbase. This multifaceted
title is especially dedicated to the players that like to constantly improve their in-game weaponry by adding new parts and upgrading old ones.
An action-imbued cooperative third-person action game set in a Sci-Fi world, Warframe offers numerous hours of qualitative
fast-paced combat. As a Tenno,
you are part of an ancient warrior civilization, and have the power of wielding the mighty Warframes and command their tremendous power.
Together, with other fearless soldiers like yourself,
you'll be able to take the fight to your opponents, the Grineer,
forging your own weapons and armor in order to reach the might you desire.
Dota is a video game that doesn't need any kind of introduction, being one of the most popular eSports in the world.
Played both by professional and casual players, this competitive game of action and strategy is played with two teams of five people, each
player being able to choose their champion from a pool of over 100 available characters. Dota 2 is enjoyed by millions of people worldwide,
and the fact that it's free-to-play is the best thing ever.
Based on the universally acclaimed Dungeons & Dragons fantasy role-playing game,
Neverwinter is an action MMORPG
with a fast-paced combat and well-written
plotline. The players can choose from one of the eight playable classes and make use of healing powers and action points that were imported from
the D&D universe that fathered this game. Neverwinter is generally perceived as more of a story-based game than a classic MMO.
An online action RPG set in a dark fantasy world, Path of Exile is the ideal title if you are into Diablo,
but don't necessarily want to pay to play it. Even though it's free,
this amazingly complex title doesn't skimp on important gameplay elements. The players who enjoy spending a lot of time exploring levels and grinding gear, while
experiencing an interesting storyline can have it all. Path of Exile is really too overlooked for how good it is.
This list couldn't be complete without adding the most
appreciated free-to-play game to ever exist on Steam. Team Fortress 2 is the most popular online action game,
and it offers endless hours of fun when played with friends,
and it is constantly updated with new game modes, maps, equipment and, most importantly, hats!
Lots of hats!
The large array of classes
you can choose from offers the perfect hero for each and every player.
This was our list highlighting some of the best free Steam games that deserve a lot more money,
and we hope you've enjoyed our video. If you did please press that 'like' button, as we do appreciate it,
and it helps us immensely. We often ask our audience for suggestions to compile these lists, and if you'd like to contribute,
please follow Frag Hero on Facebook.
If you've played other great free games, please mention them in the comments below, because we do try to read pretty much everything.
Now would also be a great time to encourage you to subscribe
because we upload new stuff all the time, so
subscribing will keep you up-to-date with all of our latest videos. You can also check out Frag Hero dot com for more gaming-related
articles, but until next time, thanks for watching, and have a great day!
